titleStmt.title: TO THE MOST VERTVOVS LEAR∣ned and bewtifull Lady Marie Countesse of Penbrooke.

publicationStmt.publisher: To the Reader: The English Preface in Print, c. 1475-1640 / Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership

analytic.title: TO THE MOST VERTVOVS LEAR∣ned and bewtifull Lady Marie Countesse of Penbrooke.

monogr.title: Parthenophil and Parthenophe : Sonnettes, madrigals, elegies and odes. To the right noble and vertuous gentleman, M. William Percy Esquier, his deerest friend
monogr.author: Barnes, Barnabe

div.head: TO THE MOST VERTVOVS LEARned and bewtifull Lady Marie Countesse of Penbrooke.

lg.l: Pride of our English Ladies, neuer match'te,
In whom euen Phoebus is most florishing,
Muses cheefe comfort, of the muses hatch'te:
On whom Vrania hath so long time watch'te,
In fames rich forte with crowne triumphing,
Of laurell euer-greene in lustie spring,
Vnto those Planettes where thou shal't haue place
With thy late sainted brother to giue light:
And with harmonious Sphoeres to turne in race.
Voutch-safe sweet Lady with a forhead bright
To shine on this poore muse, whose first borne fruite
That you of right would take, she maketh suite.
